intro: Melissa glandulosa, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is characterized by its fragrant, lemon-scented leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine for their calming properties. The plant's glandular hairs give it a distinctive texture and contribute to its aromatic profile.
